F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,' the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph on Saturday.\n\nMbappe shared images of himself as a youngster in a Real Madrid kit as well as meeting Cristiano Ronaldo onto his social media profiles shortly after the club statement.\n\n'A dream come true,' he wrote. 'So happy and proud to join the club of my dream @realmadrid.\n\nView this post on Instagram\n\nA post shared by Kylian Mbappe\u0301 (@k.mbappe)\n\nNobody can understand how excited I am right now. Hala Madrid!'\n\nThe post accumulated over five million likes in the space of 30 minutes with Madrid fans rushing to welcome their new superstar signing.\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving PSG in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume.\n\nMbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension when it expires in June.\n\nThe letter led to a standoff with the club and Mbappe was omitted from the first-team squad before being reinstated.\n\nAllowing Mbappe to run down the final year of his contract meant PSG were unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($195.95 million) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nWhen the transfer was completed, Mbappe became the second-most expensive player of all time after his former PSG team mate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017.\n\nReal Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid {"uri": "8159836005", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "18:23:03", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T18:23:03Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T18:22:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8823529481887817, "url": "https://www.rediff.com/sports/report/mbappe-is-a-galactico-signs-5-year-deal-with-real-madrid-pix/20240603.htm", "title": "Mbappe is a 'Galactico', signs 5-year deal with Real Madrid", "body": "Real Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nIMAGE: Kylian Mbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires. Photograph: Kai Pfaffenbach/Reuters\n\nFrance forward Kylian Mbappe has joined Real Madrid as a free agent on a five-year contract, the LaLiga club said on Monday, ending a transfer saga that rumbled on for years before the European champions captured their newest \"Galactico\".\n\n\"Real Madrid C. F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph.\n\nMbappe shared images of himself as a youngster in a Real Madrid kit as well as meeting Cristiano Ronaldo onto his social media profiles shortly after the club statement.\n\n\"A dream come true,\" he wrote. \"So happy and proud to join the club of my dream @realmadrid.\n\n\"Nobody can understand how excited I am right now. Can't wait to see you, Madridistas, and thanks for your unbelievable support. Hala Madrid!\"\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nIMAGE: Kylian Mbappe shared this throwback picture of when he had visited Cristiano Ronaldo at Real Madrid, when he was a kid. Photograph: Kylian Mbappe/X\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume.\n\nMbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension when it expires in June.\n\nThe letter led to a standoff with the club and Mbappe was omitted from the first-team squad before being reinstated.\n\nAllowing Mbappe to run down the final year of his contract meant PSG were unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($195.95 million) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nWhen the transfer was completed, Mbappe became the second-most expensive player of all time after his former PSG team mate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017.\n\nReal Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally in their ranks, the club can look at consolidating their dominance in LaLiga where they lost only once last season to win the title by 10 points and they were unbeaten in the Champions League.", "source": {"uri": "rediff.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Rediff.com {"uri": "8159812957", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "18:04:53", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T18:04:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T18:03:40Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8784313797950745, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2960174-kylian-mbappe-joins-real-madrid-a-dream-come-true", "title": "Kylian Mbappe Joins Real Madrid: A Dream Come True | Sports-Games", "body": "France forward Kylian Mbappe has signed a five-year contract with Real Madrid, leaving Paris St Germain as a free agent. Mbappe expressed his excitement on social media, calling it a 'dream come true.' The move concludes a years-long transfer saga, with Mbappe joining a star-studded squad in Madrid.\n\nFrance forward Kylian Mbappe has joined Real Madrid as a free agent on a five-year contract, the LaLiga club said on Monday, ending a transfer saga that rumbled on for years before the European champions captured their newest \"Galactico\".\n\n\"Real Madrid C. F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph. Mbappe shared images of himself as a youngster in a Real Madrid kit as well as meeting Cristiano Ronaldo onto his social media profiles shortly after the club statement.\n\n\"A dream come true,\" he wrote. \"So happy and proud to join the club of my dream @realmadrid. \"Nobody can understand how excited I am right now. Can't wait to see you, Madridistas, and thanks for your unbelievable support. Hala Madrid!\"\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10. Mbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles. Although Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume.\n\nMbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals. The 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension when it expires in June.\n\nThe letter led to a standoff with the club and Mbappe was omitted from the first-team squad before being reinstated. Allowing Mbappe to run down the final year of his contract meant PSG were unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($195.95 million) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nWhen the transfer was completed, Mbappe became the second-most expensive player of all time after his former PSG team mate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017. Real Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally in their ranks, the club can look at consolidating their dominance in LaLiga where they lost only once last season to win the title by 10 points and they were unbeaten in the Champions League. ($1 = 0.9186 euros)\n\n(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)", "source": {"uri": "devdiscourse.com", "dataType": "news", "title": F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph. years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner expensive player of all time after his former PSG team mate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017.\n\nReal Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally in their ranks, the club can look at consolidating their dominance in I'm very calm about it,' he had told Telefoot.\n\n'My future is no longer a huge topic at the club, no one talks to me about it anymore.\n\n'I'll be at the Euros with calm head, ready to do great things.'\n\nDespite his exit from PSG being expected from as far back as last summer, Mbappe only officially announced he would be leaving on Friday, May 10 as he shared a heartfelt message to the club's fans.\n\nDespite the constant speculation, Mbappe scored 44 goals in 48 games over the season\n\nThe 25-year-old leaves as PSG's all-time record goalscorer, having netted 256 times in Paris\n\nRead More Kylian Mbappe signs off his PSG career by winning the Coupe de France after 2-1 victory over Lyon... before striker admits his 'heart aches' as he prepares for his expected move to Real Madrid\n\n'I wanted to speak to you. first experience in a club with a lot of pressure.\n\n'To grow as a player of course, by being alongside some of the best in history - some of the greatest champions; to meet a lot of people, to grow as a man as well, with all the glory and the mistakes I've made.\n\n'It's hard, and I never thought it would be this difficult to announce that, to leave my country, France, Ligue 1, a championship I F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph.\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume.\n\nMbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension when it expires in June.\n\nThe letter led to a standoff with the club and Mbappe was omitted from the first-team squad before being reinstated.\n\nAllowing Mbappe to run down the final year of his contract meant PSG were unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($195.95 million) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nWhen the transfer was completed, Mbappe became the second-most expensive player of all time after his former PSG team mate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017.\n\nReal Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally in their ranks, the club can look at consolidating their dominance in LaLiga where they lost only once last season to win the title by 10 points and they were unbeaten in the Champions League. {"uri": "8158996113", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "09:04:47", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T09:04:47Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T09:04:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8509804010391235, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/real-madrid-will-announce-kylian-mbappe-today-with-french-superstar-set-to-sign-a-five-year-contract-after-leaving-psg/", "title": "Real Madrid 'will announce Kylian Mbappe TODAY' - with French superstar set to 'sign a five-year contract' after leaving PSG", "body": "Kylian Mbappe will reportedly be announced a Real Madrid player on Monday, with the French superstar set to sign a five-year deal with the Spanish giants.\n\nMbappe, 25, told PSG back in February that he would leave the club when his contract expires this summer.\n\nThe forward has long-been linked with a move to Real and almost joined Los Blancos in the summer of 2022, before he made a late u-turn and penned a new deal with the Ligue 1 side.\n\nHowever, according to L'Equipe, he will finally make the move, with Carlo Ancelotti's side set to announce Mbappe's arrival at some point today.\n\nThis comes after Fabrizio Romano reported on Sunday that Mbappe had signed his contract at Real, with the forward set to pen a five-year deal.\n\nKylian Mbappe will reportedly be announced as a Real Madrid player at some point on Monday\n\nThe French superstar has been chased by Real throughout his career in a long-running saga\n\nMbappe will join a Real side who won a record-extending 15th Champions League on Saturday\n\nIn a video on his X account, the Italian had said: 'Kylian Mbappe to Real Madrid... HERE WE GO.\n\n'The saga is finally over. Kylian Mbappe joins Real Madrid as a free agent at the end of the season.\n\n'The contract has been signed, the announcement will be really soon, in the next weeks, but Real Madrid will have one more star in their squad.\n\n'Kylian Mbappe joins from PSG and it's an historic HERE WE GO.'\n\nA move to the Bernabeu will finally end the speculation that has followed Mbappe throughout his career.\n\nIt was reported in February that Real - who won the Champions League on Saturday - had reached an agreement with Mbappe that would see the forward join on a free transfer in the summer, with an \u00a385.5million signing-on fee, meaning the Spanish giants will get their man after a seven-year pursuit.\n\nNo official announcement has been forthcoming, but Mbappe explained back in March that one would be made ahead of Euro 2024 in Germany this summer, where he will captain France.\n\n'People will know my future before the Euros. I'm very calm about it,' he had told Telefoot.\n\n'My future is no longer a huge topic at the club, no one talks to me about it anymore.\n\n'I'll be at the Euros with calm head, ready to do great things.'\n\nDespite his exit from PSG being expected from as far back as last summer, Mbappe only officially announced he would be leaving on Friday, May 10 as he shared a heartfelt message to the club's fans.\n\nDespite the constant speculation, Mbappe scored 44 goals in 48 games over the season\n\nThe 25-year-old leaves as PSG's all-time record goalscorer, having netted 256 times in Paris\n\n'I wanted to speak to you. I've always said that I would speak with you when the time comes, and so I wanted to announce to you all that it's my last year at Paris Saint-Germain,' he said.\n\n'I will not extend and the adventure will come to an end in a few weeks.\n\n'I will play my last game at the Parc des Princes on Sunday. It's a lot of emotion; many years where I had the chance and the great honour to be a member of the biggest French club - one of the best in the world - which allowed me to arrive here, to have my first experience in a club with a lot of pressure.\n\n'To grow as a player of course, by being alongside some of the best in history - some of the greatest champions; to meet a lot of people, to grow as a man as well, with all the glory and the mistakes I've made.\n\n'It's hard, and I never thought it would be this difficult to announce that, to leave my country, France, Ligue 1, a championship I have always known, but I think I needed this - a new challenge after seven years.'\n\nThe claims from Romano on Sunday come after L'Equipe also reported on Friday that Mbappe will be unveiled as a new Real player on Monday, fewer than 48 hours after their Champions League final triumph over Borussia Dortmund at Wembley.\n\nMeanwhile, during a training session with France on Thursday, Mbappe met with fans, and even signed one lucky person's Real shirt - a sure-fire sign that this deal will be finalised shortly.\n\nLast week, it was also reported that the relationship between PSG president Nasser Al-Khelaifi and the departing Mbappe remains strong, despite claims that a rift had emerged over the terms of his departure as a free agent.\n\nBoth the club and the player have previously stated there is an agreement in place that respects PSG's huge investment in Mbappe's development as a player since his \u00a3166m move from Monaco in 2017.\n\nMbappe is set to add significant firepower to a Real team who enjoyed a brilliant campaign\n\nMbappe is currently preparing for Euro 2024 with France, where he will captain the side\n\nMbappe won the Coupe de France in his final match for PSG, ending his last season at the club with 44 goals in 48 appearances in all competitions.\n\nThe French star then threw a farewell party for 250 guests in Paris, as his former PSG team-mates bid goodbye to him after seven years on their books.\n\nMbappe leaves as PSG's all-time record goalscorer, having scored 256 goals in 308 appearances over seven years in Paris.", "source": {"uri": "8159831116", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "18:19:13", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T18:19:13Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T18:18:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8470588326454163, "url": "https://gulfnews.com/sport/football/real-madrid-sign-france-captain-kylian-mbappe-on-free-transfer-1.102947230", "title": "Real Madrid sign France captain Kylian Mbappe on free transfer", "body": "Madrid: France forward Kylian Mbappe has joined Real Madrid as a free agent on a five-year contract, the LaLiga club said on Monday, ending a transfer saga that rumbled on for years before the European champions captured their newest \"Galactico\".\n\n\"Real Madrid C.F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph.\n\nMbappe shared images of himself as a youngster in a Real Madrid kit as well as meeting Cristiano Ronaldo onto his social media profiles shortly after the club statement.\n\n\"A dream come true,\" he wrote. \"So happy and proud to join the club of my dream @realmadrid.\n\n\"Nobody can understand how excited I am right now. Can't wait to see you, Madridistas, and thanks for your unbelievable support. Hala Madrid!\" The 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nStar-studded side\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume.\n\nMbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension when it expires in June.\n\nThe letter led to a standoff with the club and Mbappe was omitted from the first-team squad before being reinstated.\n\nSecond-most expensive player\n\nAllowing Mbappe to run down the final year of his contract meant PSG were unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($195.95 million) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nWhen the transfer was completed, Mbappe became the second-most expensive player of all time after his former PSG team mate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017.\n\nReal Madrid had courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally in their ranks, the club can look at consolidating their dominance in LaLiga where they lost only once last season to win the title by 10 points and they were unbeaten in the Champions League. ($1 = 0.9186 euros) (Reporting by Rohith Nair in Bengaluru and Anita Kobylinska in Gdansk, editing by Ed Osmond and Christian Radnedge)", "source": {"uri": "gulfnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": {"uri": "8159793521", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "17:49:08", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T17:49:08Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T17:47:11Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8352941274642944, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/sports-games/2960160-kylian-mbappe-joins-real-madrid-a-new-era-begins", "title": "Kylian Mbappe Joins Real Madrid: A New Era Begins | Sports-Games", "body": "France forward Kylian Mbappe has signed a five-year contract with Real Madrid, joining as a free agent. The move ends a prolonged transfer saga, with Mbappe leaving PSG as their all-time top scorer. He joins a star-studded Madrid squad under coach Carlo Ancelotti.\n\nFrance forward Kylian Mbappe has joined Real Madrid as a free agent on a five-year contract, the LaLiga club said on Monday, ending a transfer saga that rumbled on for years before the European champions captured their newest \"Galactico\".\n\n\"Real Madrid C. F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph. The 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany. Mbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume. Mbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club where he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension when it expires in June. This highly anticipated move will see Mbappe earning a hefty \u20ac15 million ($16.2 million) per year after taxes. Sources have revealed that the official announcement from the Spanish club is imminent and Mbappe already purchased a home in Madrid, reported by ESPN.\n\nMbappe, who will join Real Madrid on a free transfer from Paris Saint-Germain, is set to receive a significant signing-on fee of \u20ac150 million, which will be distributed over the duration of his contract. This deal highlights Real Madrid's dedication to bringing in the best talent and their belief in Mbappe's ability to make a substantial impact.\n\nA new home in Madrid for Kylian Mbappe\n\nIn preparation for his move, Mbappe has already secured a home in Madrid. The young superstar purchased the house that formerly belonged to ex-Real Madrid star Gareth Bale in the prestigious La Finca development, located on the outskirts of the city. This area is known for its privacy and luxury, making it a perfect fit for a player of Mbappe's stature.\n\nMbappe's transfer to Real Madrid has been a long time coming. The club has been interested in him for several years, and he almost joined them when he left Monaco in 2017 and again in 2022. However, he chose to stay with PSG on both occasions. Now, with his contract at PSG expired, Mbappe is finally making his dream move to Madrid.\n\nDuring a conversation with French President Emmanuel Macron at France's training camp, Mbappe hinted that the move would be officially announced by Real Madrid on Monday evening. This high-profile endorsement adds an extra layer of excitement and anticipation to the already monumental transfer.\n\nReal Madrid's recent success\n\nReal Madrid is coming off a fantastic season, having secured both the Champions League and LaLiga titles. They won their 15th European Cup by defeating Borussia Dortmund 2-0 at Wembley. The addition of Mbappe to their squad is seen as a crucial step in maintaining their dominance in European football.\n\nMbappe's arrival is expected to bolster Real Madrid's already impressive lineup. His speed, technical skills, and goal-scoring ability will add a new dimension to their attack. HERE WE GO.\n\n'The saga is finally over. Kylian Mbappe joins Real Madrid as a free agent at the end of the season.\n\n'The contract has been signed, the announcement will be really soon, in the next weeks, but Real Madrid will have one more star in their squad.\n\n'Kylian Mbappe joins from PSG and it's an historic HERE WE GO.'\n\nA move to the Bernabeu will finally end the speculation that has followed Mbappe throughout his career.\n\nThe French superstar has been chased by Real throughout his career in a long-running saga\n\nDespite the constant speculation, Mbappe scored 44 goals in 48 games over the season\n\nIt was reported in February that Real - who won the Champions League on Saturday - had reached an agreement with Mbappe that would see the forward join on a free transfer in the summer, with an \u00a385.5million signing-on fee, meaning the Spanish giants will get their man after a seven-year pursuit.\n\nNo official announcement has been forthcoming, but Mbappe explained back in March that one would be made ahead of Euro 2024 in Germany this summer, where he will captain France.\n\n'People will know my future before the Euros. I'm very calm about it,' he had told Telefoot.\n\n'My future is no longer a huge topic at the club, no one talks to me about it anymore.\n\n'I'll be at the Euros with calm head, ready to do great things.'\n\nDespite his exit from PSG being expected from as far back as last summer, Mbappe only officially announced he would be leaving on Friday, May 10 as he shared a heartfelt message to the club's fans.\n\n'I wanted to speak to you. I've always said that I would speak with you when the time comes, and so I wanted to announce to you all that it's my last year at Paris Saint-Germain,' he said.\n\n'I will not extend and the adventure will come to an end in a few weeks.\n\nThe 25-year-old leaves as PSG's all-time record goalscorer, having netted 256 times in Paris\n\n'I will play my last game at the Parc des Princes on Sunday. It's a lot of emotion; many years where I had the chance and the great honour to be a member of the biggest French club - one of the best in the world - which allowed me to arrive here, to have my first experience in a club with a lot of pressure.\n\n'To grow as a player of course, by being alongside some of the best in history - some of the greatest champions; to meet a lot of people, to grow as a man as well, with all the glory and the mistakes I've made.\n\n'It's hard, and I never thought it would be this difficult to announce that, to leave my country, France, Ligue 1, a championship I have always known, but I think I needed this - a new challenge after seven years.'\n\nMeanwhile, during a training session with France on Thursday, Mbappe met with fans, and even signed one lucky person's Real shirt - a sure-fire sign that this deal will be finalised shortly.\n\nLast week, it was also reported that the relationship between PSG president Nasser Al-Khelaifi and the departing Mbappe remains strong, despite claims that a rift had emerged over the terms of his departure as a free agent.\n\nBoth the club and the player have previously stated there is an agreement in place F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph.\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will move to Real Madrid in July when his PSG contract expires on June 30 but the forward will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his {"uri": "8159797263", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "17:51:39", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T17:51:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T17:50:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://newsable.asianetnews.com/sports/football-its-official-real-madrid-announce-blockbuster-kylian-mbappe-signing-details-of-deal-with-french-star-here-snt-seimre", "title": "It's official! Real Madrid announce blockbuster Kylian Mbappe signing; details of deal with French star here", "body": "Real Madrid officially announced the signing of French sensation and former Paris Saint-Germain superstar Kylian Mbappe, putting an end to a long saga of transfer rumors.\n\nIn a move that has been years in the making, Real Madrid has finally secured the signing of French superstar Kylian Mbappe. The announcement follows Real Madrid's triumphant 15th UEFA Champions League victory, adding another jewel to their illustrious crown.\n\nMadrid said on Monday that Mbappe agreed to a five-year contract at the Santiago Bernabeu.\n\nMbappe had announced his desire to leave French champions Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) at the end of the 2023-24 season in May after verbally agreeing to move to Los Blancos. The France international left PSG after seven years in which he scored 256 goals in 308 appearances to become the highest scorer in the Ligue 1 club's history.\n\nReports said that Mbappe, who joined the La Liga giants on a free transfer after deal with PSG ended on June 30, is expected to receive around 100 million euros as signing bonus. Mbappe, who has signed a five-year contract with Real Madrid, is reported to receive 15 million euros a year after tax.\n\nReal Madrid have admired Mbappe for long and came close to signing the Frenchman in 2022, but the former PSG star signed a 2-year contract extension with PSG after prolonged negotiations. Mbappe did not activate a one-year contract extension with PSG, allowing him to walk free of cost after the French giants had shelled out 166 million pounds to Monaco.\n\nAccording to reports, the announcement will not be followed by an immediate presentation of the 25-year-old star. Marca's report indicates that Mbappe's grand introduction to the Santiago Bernabeu faithful will occur in July, promising a record-breaking event at the sold-out stadium.\n\nThe reason behind the delay in Mbappe's presentation is his current commitment to the French national team, which is gearing up for the upcoming European Championships. France will face Luxembourg and Canada in friendly matches before heading to Germany for the month-long competition starting on June 15. The 2018 World Cup champions, one of the favourites for the Euros, are set to face Poland, the Netherlands, and Austria in a highly competitive Group D.\n\nEarlier, Mbappe reportedly confirmed the imminent announcement to French President Emmanuel Macron. During a routine visit to the French national team camp, President Macron engaged in a light-hearted exchange with Mbappe, which was captured by RMC cameras. When the president inquired about the timing of the announcement, the French sensation responded confidently, \"Tonight, tonight.\"\n\nThis transfer marks a significant milestone in Real Madrid's storied history, as Mbappe joins a roster that already boasts immense talent. The 25-year-old forward will be in good company with fellow Real Madrid stars Vinicius Junior, Rodrigo, Jude Bellingham, Eduardo Camavinga and more.\n\nThe excitement surrounding Mbappe's move to Real Madrid has electrified both the club's supporters and the footballing world at large. The French forward's exceptional skill, speed, and scoring ability make him a perfect fit for the Spanish giants, who are aiming to further cement their dominance in European football.\n\nAs the official announcement is out, fans now eagerly await the formal confirmation and subsequent presentation of Kylian Mbappe in the iconic white jersey of Real Madrid. {"uri": "8159801365", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "17:54:36", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T17:54:36Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T17:53:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8156862854957581, "url": "https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2024/06/03/665dffac268e3efa108b457e.html", "title": "Official: Real Madrid confirms signing of Kylian Mbappe", "body": "Real Madrid. Florentino Perez gets emotional: There is someone to thank!\n\nThe announcement that every Real Madrid fan has been waiting for over the past seven years finally arrived. This time it was no fake or social media montage: \"Kylian Mbappe is a new player for Real Madrid,\" declared the club on its website, causing a global sensation.\n\nThis is one of the most high-profile and impactful signings in the history of football and possibly sports. The announcement came just a few days after Real Madrid secured their 15th Champions League title, marking a monumental moment for the club.\n\nThe signing of Kylian Mbappe by Real Madrid is the epitome of a saga, filled with ups and downs, love and heartbreak, culminating in a happy ending for the club. The French superstar and Real Madrid have signed a five-year contract, keeping him at the club until 2029.\n\nThe journey to Mbappe's signing began nearly two years ago, shortly after he left Real Madrid at the altar in May 2022. Under immense pressure from Paris, France, and Qatar, Mbappe renewed his contract with PSG just when Real Madrid had everything ready to welcome him.\n\nDespite the disappointment, reconciliation quickly followed, laying the groundwork for the signing this summer. Florentino Perez, the president of Real Madrid, secured Mbappe, who worked diligently to ensure his freedom by June 30, 2024, a year earlier than initially agreed with PSG.\n\nFlorentino Perez and Mbappe executed a flawless strategy last summer to finalize the signing of the century. Perez made PSG uneasy by denying any ongoing negotiations, while Mbappe remained resolute in his decision not to extend his contract with PSG. This impeccable plan ultimately brought Mbappe to the Santiago Bernabeu.\n\nAnother effort was made in 2021, but PSG rejected a 200 million euro offer. In 2022, without negotiations, Mbappe renewed with PSG under significant pressure. Finally, on the fourth attempt, and just when many Madrid fans had resigned to the idea that he might never wear the white jersey, Mbappe joins Real Madrid.\n\nMbappe joins a champion team with far better economic conditions than he would have had in 2022. His ambition is to win everything with his new club, eyeing the Champions League and the Ballon d'Or.\n\nAlready a World Cup winner and a finalist in another with France, Mbappe's next step is to succeed at the club level, and he believes Real Madrid is the perfect stage to achieve this. Real Madrid, for its part, now has its new Galactico, a game-changing player both on and off the field.\n\nThe club enters a new dimension, bringing together stars like Bellingham, Vinicius, and Mbappe in the world's best stadium. The German side defeated Mbappe\u00b4s PSG in the semi-finals but despite being outplayed, Madrid managed to escape from London with yet another Champions League trophy.\n\nSigning for the new Spanish and European champions will give Mbappe the greatest chance of winning silverware and the game\u00b4s top individual awards in the years to follow. Mbappe has seemed destined to join Real Madrid for years, coming close on multiple occasions but this time it will finally come to fruition.\n\nThe France captain announced he would be leaving PSG on May 10 at the end of his contract, and since then Madrid fans have been waiting to celebrate the official announcement, which should arrive early next week, a source close to negotiations has told AFP.\n\nStreet vendors around the Santiago Bernabeu have been selling Mbappe scarves and shirts for months, with anticipation steadily rising in the Spanish capital. Mbappe signed a Real Madrid fan\u00b4s shirt earlier this week while training with France, another nod towards his impending switch.\n\nAs a child growing up in Paris suburb Bondy, Mbappe had numerous posters of Real Madrid\u00b4s all-time top goalscorer Cristiano Ronaldo on his walls. Mbappe\u00b4s dream move has taken a long time to come to fruition, with Madrid first attempting to lure him in 2017, when he signed for PSG from Monaco.\n\nEven the last few weeks have dragged, with Madrid wanting to announce the deal after the Champions League final, to avoid distractions. Madrid president Florentino Perez also tried to lure Mbappe to the club in 2021 and 2022, and he will finally get his way.\n\nConquering the biggest trophy in club football before capturing the game\u00b4s most prized asset days later is a demonstration of Madrid\u00b4s power. Questions over exactly how Mbappe will fit in at Madrid can be chewed on by fans at length over the summer.\n\nBoth the French forward and Vinicius Junior prefer to play coming in off the left flank, while Mbappe\u00b4s arrival could also see new Madrid star Jude Bellingham pushed into a deeper role. {"uri": "8159837800", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "18:24:46", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T18:24:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T18:23:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/football/top-stories/real-madrid-sign-france-captain-kylian-mbappe-on-free-transfer/articleshow/110675731.cms", "title": "Real Madrid sign France captain Kylian Mbappe on free transfer | Football News - Times of India", "body": "NEW DELHI: Real Madrid have announced the signing of France forward Kylian Mbappe on a five-year contract as a free agent, bringing an end to a transfer saga that lasted for years. The move sees the European champions secure their newest \"Galactico,\" adding a formidable talent to their squad.\n\n\"Real Madrid C. F. and Kylian Mbappe have reached an agreement whereby he will be a Real Madrid player for the next five seasons,\" the Spanish champions said in a statement, fresh off their 15th European Cup triumph.\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had announced he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X on May 10.\n\nMbappe will officially join Real Madrid in July after his PSG contract expires on June 30. However, before joining the club, he will be unveiled as a Real Madrid player, and then he will join up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid, featuring Ballon d'Or favorites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, under the management of Italian Carlo Ancelotti, the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nDespite winning numerous trophies at PSG, including domestic doubles and trebles, Mbappe has yet to clinch the Champions League, the only major honor missing from his impressive resume.\n\nAfter seven years at PSG, during which he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, Mbappe leaves the club as their all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nMbappe surprised PSG last year when he informed them he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension, leading to a standoff with the club before eventually being reinstated to the first-team squad.\n\nBy allowing Mbappe to run down the final year of his contract, PSG was unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($195.95 million) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nMbappe became the second-most expensive player of all time after his former PSG teammate Neymar, who was signed for 222 million euros from Barcelona in 2017.\n\nReal Madrid had previously attempted to sign Mbappe but failed to do so, with Mbappe opting to sign a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 after Real Madrid's bid was rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally joining their ranks, Real Madrid aims to consolidate their dominance in LaLiga, having won the title by 10 points last season with only one loss, and remaining unbeaten in the Champions League.\n\n(With Reuters inputs)\n\nThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. {"uri": "8159835137", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "18:22:55", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T18:22:55Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T18:21:38Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7960784435272217, "url": "https://expressdigest.com/kylian-mbappe-confirmed-as-a-real-madrid-player-as-spanish-giants-finally-get-their-man-with-french-captain-signing-on-a-free-transfer-from-psg-after-he-agreed-to-a-massive-pay-cut/", "title": "Kylian Mbappe CONFIRMED as a Real Madrid player as Spanish giants finally get their man, with French captain signing on a free transfer from PSG after he agreed to a massive pay cut", "body": "Kylian Mbappe has officially been unveiled as a Real Madrid player, bringing an end to one of the longest transfer sagas in modern football.\n\nThe French captain has long been courted by the now 15-time Champions League winners, though each turn has seen Mbappe ultimately stay at Paris Saint-Germain, signing several bumper contracts.\n\nLast summer, however, he made it clear he would not be triggering a one-year extension, before announcing that he would be leaving at the end of the season on a free.\n\nHe has agreed to take a major pay cut after signing a five-year contract, with the 25-year-old due to receive 15m euros net (\u00a312.8m) a season at Madrid, down from the 25m euros net (\u00a321.4m) he earned in Paris.\n\nMbappe posted on Instagram on Monday evening just minutes after the move was confirmed, writing: 'A dream come true.\n\nKylian Mbappe has officially been confirmed as a Real Madrid player after leaving PSG\n\nThe French superstar has been chased by Real throughout his career in a long-running saga\n\nMbappe will join a Real side who won a record-extending 15th Champions League on Saturday\n\n'So happy and proud to join the club of my dream. Nobody can understand how excited I am right now. Can't wait to see you, Madridistas, and thanks for your unbelievable support.\n\n'\u00a1Hala Madrid!'\n\nNaturally, reports of a deal already having been signed with Real emerged on Sunday after claims an agreement had been reached months ago, with Monday's announcement the final confirmation of a move that will surprise few football fans.\n\nThe official announcement comes in the wake of Los Blancos' latest European crown, and sees him join the forward line of a side dripping with superstar quality.\n\nMbappe will line up next season alongside the likes of Ballon d'Or contenders Vinicius Jnr and Jude Bellingham, as well as Brazil star Rodrygo Goes and fellow new boy Endrick, widely regarded as perhaps the greatest wonderkid on the planet.\n\nWhile Real Madrid's already embarrassing array of talent now reaches a whole new plane, it does hand Carlo Ancelotti something of a headache.\n\nHis side have romped to a 15th Champions League title - as well as the Supercopa and LaLiga crowns to boot - powered by goals from Vinicius Jnr and Rodrygo, with Bellingham playing in behind.\n\nVinicius Jnr has been the star in terms of his goal contributions with 24 strikes and 11 assists, but he currently occupies that left wing spot that Mbappe features in.\n\nTherefore, one of those would have to move into the middle or over to the right in a less natural position in order to both play, with No 9 Endrick also needing minutes to progress his development.\n\nMbappe is also regarded as a player with a sizeable ego that comes with the territory of being arguably the best player in the world, giving Ancelotti a tough decision to make on how to keep everyone happy.\n\nThough he arrives on a free deal, reports in February claimed that the player would be handed a whopping \u00a385.5million as a signing on fee - \u00a3200,000 more than the world record price Los Blancos paid for Gareth Bale in 2013.\n\nMbappe's arrival comes at a curious point in the season, with France building up to the European Championship in Germany this summer; big transfer deals ordinarily come after major tournaments, rather than beforehand.\n\nMbappe will line up with the likes of Jude Bellingham (left), Vinicius Jnr (centre) and Rodrygo Goes (right) next term\n\nMbappe put out a video on his social media channels to bid farewell to PSG supporters\n\nCarlo Ancelotti now has a positive selection headache in trying to fit Mbappe into his team\n\nHowever, the player promised that his future would become clear ahead of the competition months ago, telling Telefoot: 'People will know my future before the Euros. I'm very calm about it.\n\n'My future is no longer a huge topic at the club, no one talks to me about it anymore.\n\n'I'll be at the Euros with calm head, ready to do great things.'\n\nHe also put out an official statement with an emotional farewell video for PSG fans ahead of their final games of the season.\n\n'I wanted to speak to you. I've always said that I would speak with you when the time comes, and so I wanted to announce to you all that it's my last year at Paris Saint-Germain,' he said.\n\n'I will not extend and the adventure will come to an end in a few weeks.\n\n'I will play my last game at the Parc des Princes on Sunday. It's a lot of emotion; many years where I had the chance and the great honour to be a member of the biggest French club - one of the best in the world - which allowed me to arrive here, to have my first experience in a club with a lot of pressure.\n\n'To grow as a player of course, by being alongside some of the best in history - some of the greatest champions; to meet a lot of people, to grow as a man as well, with all the glory and the mistakes I've made.\n\nMbappe posed with a fan in a Real Madrid shirt at France training ahead of the Euros\n\nMbappe's announcement comes less than 48 hours after the club won the Champions League\n\nMbappe is currently preparing for Euro 2024 with France, where he will captain the side\n\n'It's hard, and I never thought it would be this difficult to announce that, to leave my country, France, Ligue 1, a championship I have always known, but I think I needed this - a new challenge after seven years.'\n\nFans were, however, heard booing his name as it was read out ahead of their final home game of the season, which ended with defeat by Toulouse, though the Frenchman did get on the scoresheet.\n\nFrench outlet L'Equipe reported on Friday that Mbappe was set to be unveiled as a new Real Madrid player on Monday, less than 48 hours after their Champions League final triumph over Borussia Dortmund at Wembley.\n\nMeanwhile, during a training session with France on Thursday, Mbappe met with fans, and even signed one lucky person's Real Madrid shirt - a sure-fire sign that this deal will be finalised shortly.\n\nIt was also reported in May that the relationship between PSG president Nasser Al-Khelaifi and the departing Mbappe remains strong, despite claims that a rift had emerged over the terms of his departure as a free agent.\n\nBoth the club and the player have previously stated there is an agreement in place that respects PSG's huge investment in Mbappe's development as a player since his \u00a3166m move from Monaco in 2017.\n\nMbappe won the Coupe de France in his final match for PSG, ending his last season at the club with 44 goals in 48 appearances in all competitions.\n\nIt is thought Mbappe's relationship with PSG club president Nasser Al-Khelaifi (right) is solid despite reports of a fall out\n\nThe French captain leaves PSG as their record goal scorer with 256 in 308 appearances over seven years\n\nThe French star then threw a farewell party for 250 guests in Paris, as his former PSG team-mates bid goodbye to him after seven years on their books.\n\nMbappe leaves as PSG's all-time record goalscorer, having scored 256 goals in 308 appearances over seven years in Paris.", "source": {"uri": "expressdigest.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "expressdigest.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": {"uri": "8159826676", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "18:16:59", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T18:16:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T18:14:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7882353067398071, "url": "https://www.newagebd.net/post/football/236871/mbappe-signs-five-year-deal-with-real-madrid", "title": "Mbappe signs five-year deal with Real Madrid", "body": "Kylian Mbappe has signed a five-year deal to move to Real Madrid from Paris Saint-Germain, the Spanish club announced on Monday.\n\nThe announcement is the culmination of Real's long courtship of one of the most prolific forwards in world football.\n\n'Real Madrid have reached an agreement for the player to be at Real Madrid for the next five seasons,' the club said in a statement.\n\nMbappe, 25, said on social media the move was 'a dream come true'.\n\n'So happy and proud to join the club of my dream @realmadrid. Nobody can understand how excited I am right now. Can't wait to see you, Madridistas, and thanks for your unbelievable support,' Mbappe added.\n\nHe will earn 35 million euros ($38 million) a season, according to reports in Spain.\n\nMbappe had verbally agreed to move to Real in February and then announced in May he would leave PSG at the end of the season.\n\nReal, fresh from winning their 15th Champions League on Saturday with a 2-0 victory against Borussia Dortmund, moved to confirm the deal on Monday before Mbappe is involved in pre-Euro 2024 friendlies for France.\n\nA World Cup winner as a teenager in 2018, Mbappe scored a club record 256 goals for PSG since joining the Qatar-owned club from Monaco on an initial loan in 2017.\n\nHe eventually moved to PSG in a 180-million-euro ($195 million) deal -- all at the age of 18.\n\nMbappe helped PSG to six Ligue 1 titles and steered them to the 2020 Champions League final, but they lost to Bayern Munich.\n\nHe scored a hat-trick in the World Cup final against Argentina in Qatar in 2022 but still finished on the losing side as Lionel Messi's Argentina won on penalties.\n\nPSG lavished huge sums to put Mbappe, Brazil star Neymar and Messi in the same team, hoping to finally unlock the Champions League puzzle. But the French club came up short.\n\nAs Mbappe's fame has grown, so has his importance to both the French national team and France the country.\n\nPresident Emmanuel Macron intervened to persuade him to stay at PSG in June 2022 when a move to Real seemed almost cut and dried.\n\nAt Real, who also won back the La Liga title from fierce rivals Barcelona this season, Mbappe will form a formidable attacking trio with Brazilian forward Vinicius Jr and England international midfielder Jude Bellingham.", "source": {"uri": "newagebd.net", "dataType": "news", "title": "New Age | The Most Popular "https://outspoken.newagebd.com/files/img/202406/e67fc62c084dd7b21aac73f65099cfd6_og_og.png", "originalArticle": null, "storyUri": "eng-9618706", "eventUri": "eng-9618706", "location": null, {"uri": "8159779799", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "17:37:41", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T17:37:41Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T17:35:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7843137383460999, "url": "https://www.nytimes.com/athletic/5536629/2024/06/03/kylian-mbappe-real-madrid-psg-transfer-inside-deal/", "title": "The full inside story of Kylian Mbappe's Real Madrid transfer", "body": "Real Madrid have been trying to land Kylian Mbappe for years -- and now they finally have their man.\n\nThe 25-year-old Frenchman's signing was confirmed on Monday, more than two years on from their previous attempt to bring him in.\n\nIn May 2022, Mbappe dramatically turned down a move to Madrid, making a last-minute decision to renew his contract at Paris Saint-Germain instead. This time, things have gone much more smoothly, and there is great excitement among everyone at Madrid over the arrival of one of the world's best players, especially with the squad that just won the club's 15th European Cup/Champions League already brimming with young talent.\n\nBut that doesn't mean the free-agent transfer has been without intrigue -- and nor was it totally unopposed.\n\nThis is the full story of how Madrid finally signed Mbappe.\n\nThe start of 2024 marked the beginning of the end.\n\nIn early January, at Madrid's Valdebebas training complex -- where the club's offices are also located -- it was agreed that a final attempt to sign Mbappe would be made.\n\nSeveral meetings were held on the matter, but some senior figures at Madrid were not convinced it was a good idea.\n\nThe thinking behind this was two-fold. First of all, there were concerns the club's interests could be damaged again after Mbappe's rejection two years ago. Others simply thought the time was not right -- for both sporting and economic reasons.\n\nSome preferred to be more cautious with the club's finances -- which are in good shape, even with the extensive remodelling of their Santiago Bernabeu stadium, which will cost at least \u20ac1.3billion (\u00a31.1bn; $1.4bn at current rates).\n\nSome thought the positive dressing-room atmosphere could be affected by Mbappe entering as the highest-paid player when the vast majority of his new team-mates had won more trophies for the club. Some thought Madrid could get by fine without him -- especially with 17-year-old Brazilian Endrick set to arrive and the team already performing admirably.\n\nIn short: there was a view that Madrid's project was working really well without Mbappe.\n\nBut club president Florentino Perez decided nonetheless that another attempt would be made, with the above factors taken into account. It was also decided that Mbappe would be given a deadline to respond to this new proposal, the terms of which would be lower than the one in 2022. According to sources familiar with those previous talks -- like all sources cited in this article, they preferred to speak anonymously to protect relationships -- Mbappe was offered a six-season contract with a \u20ac130million signing bonus and a salary of \u20ac26m a year.\n\nMbappe took a first step of his own on January 3 when, without consulting PSG, he stopped to speak with reporters after PSG beat Toulouse in the Trophee des Champions -- a game between the previous season's winners of Ligue 1 and the French Cup, much like the Community Shield in England.\n\n\"In 2022, I didn't know my decision until May,\" Mbappe said in reply to questions about his future -- it being the start of a new year, he was now into the final six months of his contract and free to negotiate with interested clubs.\n\n\"If I know what I want to do, I shouldn't let the decision drag on. It wouldn't make any sense.\"\n\nMeanwhile, PSG president Nasser Al-Khelaifi said the club wanted him to stay: \"He is the best player in the world, and the best thing for him is PSG. He is at the heart of the project. I ask everyone to leave Kylian in peace.\"\n\nMbappe's words were interpreted positively in the Spanish capital, where Madrid were already working on the detail of their offer. When what they were proposing reached the player's entourage in the following days, the club made it known that his salary (the offer was for slightly more than Vinicius Junior and Jude Bellingham were getting) and signing fee would make him their best-paid player.\n\nPerez was in regular contact with Mbappe during this process, something that is unusual for Madrid's club president. Ordinarily, his right-hand man, their director general Jose Angel Sanchez, conducts negotiations. Mbappe told Perez he was keen on the move. All the while Madrid insisted, through briefings to the media, that they had no interest in the player. But the reality was quite different -- as The Athletic reported on numerous occasions.\n\nSanchez travelled to Paris before Madrid took part in the four-club Supercopa de Espana tournament, which was played in Saudi Arabia from January 10-14. He returned full of optimism -- another good sign, as he is usually cautious and very restrained.\n\nBy the end of that month, everyone at Madrid believed a deal would be done. But still there was no definitive agreement. Some people close to Mbappe were not as clear on the move as he was.\n\nAs reported by The Athletic in mid-February, influential members of his entourage were unconvinced by the offer because it was below what he was making at PSG, and could earn from another potential suitor.\n\nIn talks with Perez, the president outlined how signing for Madrid would take the player's profile to another sporting and marketing level, which would help bring in further personal revenue. With a few exceptions such as Vinicius Jr, the split at Madrid over image rights is usually 50 per cent for the club and 50 per cent for the player, although the share for Mbappe is expected to be in his favour.\n\nSources at PSG still felt it was likely that Mbappe would leave. They recalled how he had already decided last summer against taking up an option to stay for an extra year, and knew he had repeatedly expressed admiration for Madrid.\n\nBut these sources also explained that PSG felt \"protected economically\". They described an agreement in principle with Mbappe that would see the club compensated financially if he did leave following the expiry of his contract on June 30. They said it was a complex arrangement that covered several scenarios -- including the France captain waiving certain loyalty bonuses he might otherwise have been entitled to. Mbappe himself has also talked of \"all parties being protected\" when he leaves, and discussions on this aspect are still ongoing.\n\nIt remains to be seen exactly what agreement, if any, Mbappe and PSG make in this regard. But the French champions have always sought to stress that any departure for the forward at the end of the 2023-24 season would not be a 'free transfer' in their eyes.\n\nThen came a key development.\n\nOn February 13, a Tuesday, Real Madrid played away against RB Leipzig in the first leg of a Champions League last-16 tie. Senior club figures travelled with inside information. They had been told Mbappe would inform PSG of his decision to depart at the end of the season.\n\nThe news did not become public until the Thursday, but with the Madrid squad still in Germany, the club's board informed head coach Carlo Ancelotti. Without being told whether or not Mbappe had actually signed a contract, the Italian was made to understand that he could count on having the striker in his squad for next season.\n\nAbout 10 days later, Mbappe was spotted on Spanish soil, but in Barcelona not Madrid, enjoying a few days off. One source told The Athletic he had gone to the capital first to sign his contract.\n\nOnly this week, in early June, did two more sources share further information on the February talks. They said this was when Mbappe's move was sealed.\n\nThe final stages of negotiations were conducted in utmost secrecy. Madrid do tend to operate this way, but sources involved in the deal also said Mbappe's mother and agent Fayza Lamari requested there be no leaks at all, in order for her son to be as protected as possible during his final months with PSG.\n\nSome tensions between Mbappe and PSG followed, with manager Luis Enrique occasionally substituting him or leaving him out altogether. \"We have to get used to playing without him,\" the Spaniard said in March.\n\nAfter being replaced at half-time of a goalless draw away to Monaco, his first professional club, on March 1, Mbappe sat in the stands with his family instead of on the bench with team-mates. Watching the rest of the match just a few rows away were members of the PSG board, and reports said there was a heated conversation between them and his mum. Madrid and the player's camp believe PSG penalised Mbappe by reducing his playing time. Sources at the French club dismiss this as untrue.\n\nThe end was drawing near, but the fact both PSG and Madrid were still competing in the Champions League added to the strategy of total discretion. Three days after PSG were eliminated by Borussia Dortmund in the semi-finals, however, Mbappe made his decision to leave public.\n\n\"I need a new challenge after seven years,\" he said, while thanking almost everyone at the club (most notably, Al-Khelaifi was not mentioned), but they did not know it was coming.\n\nMbappe wanted to make the announcement before PSG's final home game of the season on Sunday, May 12. The club decided not to organise anything special for him, but the team's ultras (with whom Mbappe had shared a barbecue on the Friday) dedicated a huge tifo to him.\n\nThe following Monday, newspaper Le Parisien reported that, in the run-up to the game, Al-Khelaifi and Mbappe had an argument, with the former reproaching the latter for not mentioning him in his farewell video.\n\nA PSG source strongly denied this happened, adding that an agreement with Mbappe over the economic terms of his departure was almost done.\n\nLater that Monday, Mbappe was named Ligue 1's player of the year for a fifth consecutive season. In his acceptance speech, he did acknowledge Al-Khelaifi, who in 2021, 2022 and 2023 repeated that his star player would not leave PSG for free.\n\n\"The new chapter will be very exciting,\" Mbappe said of his next move, without revealing the identity of his next club. \"Maybe it's not the time (for everyone) to find out.\"\n\nThe big reveal was always expected to come after the Champions League final, this past Saturday. Madrid did not want anything, not even the biggest signing they have ever made, to distract attention from something so important and difficult to achieve.\n\nEarly on Monday, two days after the club won a record-extending 15th European Cup/Champions League title, The Athletic reported the announcement would be made this week.\n\nNow it is finally done -- and fans can excitedly look forward to seeing Mbappe in that famous white kit.", "source": {"uri": "nytimes.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The New York Times"}, "authors": [{"uri": "mario_cortegana@nytimes.com", "name": "Mario Mbappe", "body": "Real Madrid confirm signing of France captain MbappeStaff WritersReutersTue, 4 June 2024 2:00AM\n\nKylian Mbappe has joined Real Madrid as a free agent on a five-year contract, the LaLiga club has announced, confirming a transfer saga that has rumbled on for years.\n\nThe 25-year-old captain of the French national team had revealed he was leaving Paris St Germain in a video posted on social media platform X, formerly twitter, on May 10.\n\nMbappe will complete the move in July after his PSG contract expires on June 30, but will be unveiled before joining up with the France squad for the European Championship in Germany.\n\nMbappe joins a star-studded side in Madrid with the likes of Ballon d'Or favourites Vinicius Jr. and Jude Bellingham, led by Italian Carlo Ancelotti -- the most successful coach in Champions League history with five titles.\n\nTheNightlyGet in front of tomorrow's news for FREE\n\nJournalism for the curious Australian across politics, business, culture and opinion.\n\nREAD NOW\n\nAlthough Mbappe won several trophies at PSG, often completing domestic doubles and trebles, the Champions League has eluded him and remains the only major honour left to complete his sparkling resume.\n\nMbappe leaves PSG after seven years at the club in which he won six Ligue 1 titles and four French Cups, finishing his career in the capital city as the club's all-time top scorer with 256 goals.\n\nThe 2018 World Cup winner surprised PSG last year when he sent a letter stating he would not take up the option of a one-year contract extension.\n\nThe letter led to a stand-off with the club and Mbappe was omitted from the first-team squad before being re-instated.\n\nMbappe running down the final year of his contract meant PSG were unable to recoup any of the 180 million euro ($A290m) transfer fee they paid in 2017 to sign him from AS Monaco.\n\nReal Madrid courted Mbappe in the past but failed to land the player, who signed a contract extension with PSG in May 2022 when the Spanish club had a bid rejected.\n\nWith Mbappe finally in their ranks, the club can look at consolidating their dominance in LaLiga where they lost only once last season to win the title by 10 points. They were also unbeaten as they won the Champions League for the 15th time.\n\nGet the latest news from thewest.com.au in your inbox.\n\nSign up for our emails", "source": {"uri": "thewest.com.au", {"uri": "8158986684", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "08:59:04", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T08:59:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T08:58:15Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7803921699523926, "url": "https://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2024/06/03/kylian-mbappes-real-madrid-moved-explained-as-european-champions-finalise-their-first-summer-signing/", "title": "Kylian Mbappe's Real Madrid moved explained as European champions finalise their first summer signing", "body": "Kylian Mbappe has finally signed for Real Madrid, ending a chase which dates back more than a decade.\n\nHITC sources have confirmed that Mbappe has put pen-to-paper on a five-year deal at the Santiago Bernabeu, and he will officially join the newly crowned European champions on July 1, after his contract with Paris Saint-Germain expires.\n\nHITC revealed in February that Real Madrid and Mbappe had agreed terms on their move, but neither side was ready to announce the move out of respect to PSG and the club's fans.\n\nPSG were also at this point still in the Champions League and Mbappe did not want to disrupt their quest for European glory. Real for their part also wanted to wait for their season to be complete - which actually resulted in them sealing both the La Liga and Champions League crowns.\n\nIn May, HITC revealed that Mbappe and Real were discussing how the deal would be finalised and announced - as his dream move to Madrid edged close to completion.\n\n25-year-old Mbappe first spoke to Real Madrid aged just 11, which he was training at the famed French academy at Clairefontaine - indeed most of Europe recognised his abilities then, but at 14 he opted for Monaco.\n\nReal Madrid tried for him again when he left Monaco in 2017 - but the 18-year-old headed back to his hometown of Paris, as he became the most expensive teenager in footballing history as he cost \u00a3150million.\n\nMadrid have always maintained an interest in Mbappe and in the summer of 2022, it was widely expected that he would finally seal a move to the Spanish capital - but instead, he opted to sign a new extension at PSG, two-years with an option. But it was an option that needed to be agreed by both sides.\n\nAnd the option was to become particularly newsworthy as in the summer of 2023 as PSG notified the player of their decision to exercise their half, they were shocked when Mbappe confirmed he would not be taking his.\n\nPSG reacted furiously and he was dropped from the first-team squad and they tried to sell him to Saudi Arabia with Al-Hilal making a world-record bid - but Mbappe had no intention of moving anywhere other than Madrid.\n\nNow, Mbappe and Real Madrid have signed and sealed their deal, but what will that look like? HITC's Football Financial Expert Adam Williams fills us in on the major aspects of the deal and what it means for Real and Mbappe.\n\n\"In raw financial terms, the cash Real have saved in lieu of a transfer fee is mostly wiped out by Mbappe's astronomical signing bonus.\n\n\"But as that figure is being paid out over five years, it will be more modest than am upfront transfer fee of equivalent value in terms of how UEFA assesses financial fair play.\n\n\"With Real paying the player around \u00a325.6m per year out of that pot as well as \u00a312.8m salary, that equates to around \u00a338.4m per season which will be deducted from their FFP calculation.\n\n\"That's around a tenth of the club's total annual wage bill but, I would argue, still represents comparatively good value in the scope of their overall playing budget.\"\n\nMbappe has taken a pay-cut from PSG, but he is also in line to make big money off his own brand at Real.\n\n\"The Mbappe deal is unusual in one respect in that he is believed to have kept 80 per cent of his image rights, whereas Real have historically given their Galacticos a far more moderate cut.\n\n\"The specifics of their arrangement with Adidas menawhile are not known, but they probably get somewhere between 8-12 per cent of every unit sold.\n\n\"So while an Mbappe-inspired upswing in shirt sales might bank Real an extra few million per season, it Nobody can understand how excited I am right now. Can't wait to see you, Madridistas, and thanks for your unbelievable support. \u00a1Hala Madrid!\"\n\nThe captain of France's five-year contract reportedly includes a \u20ac150m signing-on fee to be paid in instalments over the deal.\n\nThe move will only strengthen Madrid's position, both in Spain as the reigning La Liga champions and ahead of next season's reformatted Champions League. Mbappe joins a young, star-studded squad containing Jude Bellingham, Vincius Jr, Rodrygo, Federico Valverde, Aurelien Tchouameni and Edouardo Camavinga, while Brazilian wonderkid Endrick is also poised to join the club this summer.\n\nMbappe leaves Paris Saint-Germain after seven years in the French capital, having joined from Monaco for \u00a3165m following an initial loan move. The 25-year-old claimed six league titles in Paris as well as several domestic cups, but failed to win the Champions League, losing the 2020 final to Bayern Munich.\n\nMbappe's goal will now be to win the trophy with which Madrid have become synonymous, having won six of the past 10 European titles.\n\nHe will also have eyes on finally landing the Ballon d'Or, the game's top individual prize which has been dominated for so long by Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. No player born later than 1987 has ever won the award, but that is likely to change this year as stars of the new generation - including Mbappe, Vinicius Jr and Bellingham, as well as Manchester City's Rodri and Erling Haaland - ascend to the top of the sport.\n\nMbappe wore the No 7 shirt at PSG but with Vinicius already occupying that number at Madrid, the new signing will presumably take up the vacant No 9 jersey worn by fellow Frenchman Karim Benzema for more than a decade before he departed for Saudi Arabia last summer.\n\nIf that is the case, Mbappe would follow a line of legendary Real Madrid players who wore No 9, including Alfredo di Stefano, Hugo Sanchez and Ronaldo Nazario.", "source": {"uri": "sports.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo Sports"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "8158529262", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-06-03", "time": "02:31:45", "dateTime": "2024-06-03T02:31:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-06-03T02:30:19Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://pattayaone.news/kylian-mbappe-to-real-madrid-85m-bonus-and-announcement-this-week/", "title": "Kylian Mbappe to Real Madrid: \u00a385m Bonus, Announcement Soon", "body": "Kylian Mbappe, the French football superstar, is set to be announced as a Real Madrid player this week, with a signing bonus of just over \u00a385 million (\u20ac100 million). After leaving Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the season, the 25-year-old forward is poised to join the Spanish giants on a free transfer.\n\nMbappe, who scored 256 goals in 308 appearances for PSG, will sign a five-year contract at the Santiago Bernabeu, earning \u00a312.8 million (\u20ac15 million) per year after tax. Real Madrid will pay the signing bonus in installments over the course of his contract. The club has been long-time admirers of Mbappe and previously attempted to sign him in 2022, but he chose to extend his stay at PSG for an additional two years, which has now expired.\n\nBy not activating a one-year extension in his PSG contract, Mbappe was able to move for free, six years after costing PSG \u00a3166 million.\n\nThe move sees Mbappe taking a pay cut from his previous \u20ac75 million (\u00a363.9 million) gross annual salary at PSG, where he also received a \u20ac30 million-a-year (\u00a325.6 million) signing-on bonus. His departure has freed up at least \u20ac220 million (\u00a3187.5 million) of gross costs for PSG.\n\nSpanish football journalist Semra Hunter expressed a collective sigh of relief among Real Madrid supporters, who have anticipated this move for several years. The transfer saga, which began when Mbappe was 11 and visited Real Madrid for a trial, has finally concluded. There is a sense of both excitement and apprehension among fans, given Mbappe's previous decision to stay in Paris in 2022, which left many disappointed.\n\nHunter also discussed how Mbappe might fit into Real Madrid's tactical setup. Under the assumption that manager Carlo Ancelotti sticks with a 4-4-2 formation, Mbappe and Vinicius Jr. could form a formidable two-pronged attack, supported by Jude Bellingham at the top of the midfield diamond. Alternatively, in a 4-3-3 setup, Mbappe could play centrally with Vinicius and Rodrygo on the wings, though this might require sacrificing a midfielder from Real Madrid's stacked roster.\n\nThe 2024 summer transfer window in the Premier League opens on June 14, coinciding with the start of Euro 2024, and closes on August 30 at 11 PM UK time. The dates align with other major European leagues following discussions with football associations across England, Germany, Italy, Spain, and France.", "source": {"uri": "pattayaone.news", "dataType":
